content: less than 20s in any langage I know.

After reading the description, I don't know what to do if the two given bound (bound1 and bound2) are not sorted (if bound1 > bound2). You should be more clear about the "reverse" bound values, and maybe about the possible negative factor.

I don't think so. Try it for real.

Took me 4 minutes and one failed attempt, and I was already spoiled by a glance at the test/validators.

OK: 30s

read  f
read  b1
read b2
factor=${f/-/}
if [ $b1 -lt $b2 ]; then bound1=$b1;bound2=$b2; else bound1=$b2;bound2=$b1; fi

seq $[(bound1+factor-1)/factor*factor] $(echo $factor|tr -d "-" ) $bound2 | xargs


And YES it's the ugliest code I have
